Job Title: Technician III - Controls 2nd Shift

Location: Springfield, TN

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Manufacturing, Production

Description:
Join us in our exciting quest to build the future home.

At Electrolux, a leading global appliance company, we strive every day to shape living for the better for our consumers, our people, and our planet. We share ideas and collaborate so that together, we can develop solutions that deliver enjoyable and sustainable living.

Come join us as you are. We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and more innovative. In our global community of people from 100+ countries, we listen to each other, actively contribute, and grow together.

All about the role:

In this role you will be reporting to the Manufacturing Engineering Manager for Electrolux Major Appliances NA. You will be based in Springfield, TN and this role is onsite. The Controls Technician will help support the Controls department in troubleshooting of production equipment controls failures and correction to ensure it operates properly. Controls Technicians work in a reactionary way for reducing unscheduled equipment controls related downtime and perform planned improvement projects to reduce and eliminate controls failures. The Controls Technician will be the equipment controls expert, assisting Maintenance as requested for the assigned shift to troubleshoot and repair machine controls related issues. The successful candidate will demonstrate the ability to work independently as possible and in a team atmosphere as required, using their technical and communication skills to correct or improve equipment controls.

What youâ€™ll do: 

Provide technical controls support to all Maintenance Technicians, Process Technicians, and EngineersAssist Maintenance with the daily support of machine controls downtime issuesEnsure immediate controls intervention as required to solve any equipment controls issues relevant in the field and follow up actions necessaryProvide daily reports of shift controls activities, issues and resolution, emerging issues and concernsCommunicate, and cooperate with engineering and operations to maximize production uptimeEnsure adherence to safety rules and standards and maintain good housekeepingBe available prior and after shift to ensure a timely shift transitionPerform scheduled controls improvement tasks and projects as assigned by the Controls EngineersPractice continual efforts consistent with minimizing scrap, rework, and controlling costs of expendables and product

Who you are: 

You work efficiently and proactively to deliver results. You can balance commercial considerations without compromising on quality, evaluating the data to inform decision-making and continuous improvement. You build trust, good working relationships and communicate effectively with your colleagues and across functions. You appreciate and understand process and the project goals. You have a vision and a purpose, and you can inspire and influence others to not only share it but apply their abilities to achieving it. You set the pace and the priorities, and then you bring a methodical approach to meeting your goals.

Qualifications Required: 

Mechatronics Associates Degree (or similar) from an accredited university4+ years experience in an automated manufacturing environmentPLC troubleshooting and program updates - Siemens TIA Portal or Allen-BradleyHMI troubleshooting - Siemens Comfort Panel or Allen-Bradley FactoryTalkProficient in Office Products (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)

As part of Electrolux, we will continuously invest in you and your development. There are no barriers to where your career could take you.

Find more on: 

Electrolux North America: https://www.linkedin.com/company/electrolux/life/northamerica/

Electrolux Careers: https://career.electroluxgroup.com/global/en

Electrolux Home Products, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE). Qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, or veteran status. If you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process because of a disability, it is available upon request through hrsnorthamerica@electrolux.com. The company is pleased to provide such assistance, and no applicant will be penalized as a result of such a request.

Experience Level (if available): None
